page.title: 18TRAVEL IN BUCKLAND BREWER
page.content:
OF THE LOCAL PEOPLE WHO TRAVEL OUT OF THE IMMEDIATE AREA TO WORK, FORTY PERCENT TRAVEL TO {BIDEFORD, }A DISTANCE OF SIX MILES. TWENTY PERCENT TRAVEL FIVE MILES TO {GREAT {TORRINGTON,}AND FIFTEEN PERCENT HAVE A FIFTEEN MILE JOURNEY TO {BARNSTAPLE.}
THERE IS NO REGULAR DAILY PUBLIC TRANSPORT SERVICE IN THE AREA. ALMOST EIGHTY PERCENT OF THE PEOPLE INTERVIEWED REVEALED THAT THEY TRAVEL TO WORK BY{CAR OR VAN.}A FURTHER FIVE PERCENT USE {MOTOR CYCLE }FOR THEIR DAILY JOURNEY TO WORK. TWO PERCENT, ALL WITH RELATIVELY SHORT JOURNEYS, TRAVEL BY{PEDAL CYCLE.}THIRTEEN PERCENT {WALK}TO THEIR WORK.
